description:
Orobix is an engineering company focused on delivering AI-based
solutions to businesses, in multiple domains including life-science and
manufacturing.

The application of deep learning to real world problems and mission
critical contexts is laden with potential pitfalls, involving project
execution all the way to the deployment of

models in production. Orobix has engineered systems with deep learning
at their core, ranging from medical image segmentation to industrial
quality inspection. In its operations, Orobix has devised strategies to
cope with the cost of collecting data, gathering annotations from
experts, training data- efficient models, deploying models in
production, monitoring and communicating results back to experts. This
talk represents an opportunity for us to share where we started from and
where we’re at, what worked and what didn’t, and what we think is laying
ahead of us, both individually and collectively in the applied AI
community.

**Feedback form:** https://python.it/feedback-1807

in \_\_on **Saturday 4 May** at 12:15 `**See
schedule** </en/sprints/schedule/pycon10/>`__
title: Orobix: AI gets to work!
